message_1: What is the bond energy required to break a C-C bond and a C-H bond in methane gas (CH4)?
message_2:
Methane (CH4) does not have a C-C bond, as it consists of one carbon atom bonded to four hydrogen atoms. However, I can provide you with the bond energy required to break a C-H bond in methane.

The bond energy required to break a C-H bond in methane is approximately 414 kJ/mol.
